activities: Scout Exchange offers and hosts a software product called Scout that acts as a venue for employers, on the one hand, and search firms, on the other, to match qualified and interested candidates with unfilled employment positions (the “Software”). The Software is integrated with and accessed through the employer's and recruiter's Applicant Tracking System (“ATS”). Scout Exchange also runs a website which provides a venue to learn more about Scout Exchange and the services and software it offers.   In the course of conducting its business and to provide the Software, Scout Exchange collects and stores certain personal data including (i) the personal information of persons whose information has been submitted by an application and/or resume to a third party search firm (Scout Exchange collects information under the direction of its client and has no direct relationship with the individuals whose personal data it processes), and  (ii) contact and billing information of  business associates including applicant tracking systems, staffing agencies, and employers who have registered to use the Software, and (iii) contact information of potential customers to whom Scout Exchange is referred.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: For organizational human resources data Scout Exchange will work with the EU data protection authorities and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner.  For all other categories of data Scout Exchange will work with TRUSTe to maintain compliance and to fully investigate and resolve complaints.
